SEARCH
Package tetrisgame

Class Tetromino

java.lang.Object
tetrisgame.Tetromino
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Tetromino extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a Tetromino, the main building block of Tetris gameplay. A Tetromino consists of multiple squares and can move or rotate on the Tetris board.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Tetromino(int i, int x, TetrisPanel t)
    Constructs a new Tetromino with the specified shape (TetroShape), initial x-position, and Tetris panel (TetrisPanel).

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    activate()
    Activates the Tetro Allows for storing Tetrominos without them being moved down/in the game
    boolean
    canRotate()
    Checks if the Tetromino can be rotated 90 degrees clockwise Copies the shape of the Tetromino and checks if the rotated shape with the same origin would be out of bounds or collide with a locked square TetrisSquare

    isStopped(int[] offset, Coord start)
    Checking if the Tetromino is stopped by a locked square (TetrisSquare)
    void
    lockTetro()
    Sets the locked flag of the squares (TetrisSquare) occupied by the Tetromini This makes it so its a locked in place element of the Board
    void
    moveDown()
    Moves the current Tetromino down by one First check if moving down is in bounds and whether it collides with a locked square If can move down push the origin (topleft) Coord of the Tetro down by one Reassign the squares TetrisSquare occupied by the Tetro according to the new origin If can't be moved further down, lock the Squares of the Tetro
    void
    moveLeft()
    Moves the Tetromino to the left by one column Wrapped in invokelater Checks if moving left is in bounds or stopped by a locked square If moving left is possible do it, reassign sqaures TetrisSquare
    void
    moveRight()
    Moves the Tetromino to the right by one column Wrapped in invokelater Checks if moving right is in bounds or stopped by a locked square If moving left is possible do it, reassign sqaures TetrisSquare
    void
    pushDown()
    Pushes the Tetro down as far as possible First we copy the the origin coordinate, and then simulate dropping it down by 1 row while as long as it doesnt hit the bottom or a locked tetro After we find the lowest possible coordinate we set this for the Tetro Height, width and occupied squares need to be recalculated aswell.
    void
    rotate()
    Rotates the Tetromino if possible, determined by canRotate() method Wrapped in swingutilites.invokelater to ensure that its thread safe with the gameloop With rotation the occupied squares, width and height of the Tetromino also changes, these are reassigned after rotation

    Starts a thread to manage the movement of the Tetromino.
    void
    stopMovementThread()
    Stops the thread handling the downward movement of the Tetromino Sets the active flag to false

  • Constructor Details

    • Tetromino

      public Tetromino(int i, int x, TetrisPanel t)
      Constructs a new Tetromino with the specified shape (TetroShape), initial x-position, and Tetris panel (TetrisPanel).
      Parameters:
      i - Index of the shape type.
      x - Initial x-coordinate of the Tetromino.
      t - Reference to the Tetris panel.

  • Method Details

    • startMovementThread

      public void startMovementThread()
      Starts a thread to manage the movement of the Tetromino. The thread continuously moves the Tetromino down while active This way the downward movement is desynchronized from the main loop

    • isStopped

      public boolean isStopped(int[] offset, Coord start)
      Checking if the Tetromino is stopped by a locked square (TetrisSquare)
      Parameters:
      offset - the direction we want to move the Tetro
      start - The current origin of the tetro
      Returns:
      True if the Tetro is stopped, False otherwise

    • canRotate

      public boolean canRotate()
      Checks if the Tetromino can be rotated 90 degrees clockwise Copies the shape of the Tetromino and checks if the rotated shape with the same origin would be out of bounds or collide with a locked square TetrisSquare
      Returns:
      True if rotating the Tetro can be done without illegal behaviour, False if not

    • stopMovementThread

      public void stopMovementThread()
      Stops the thread handling the downward movement of the Tetromino Sets the active flag to false

    • lockTetro

      public void lockTetro()
      Sets the locked flag of the squares (TetrisSquare) occupied by the Tetromini This makes it so its a locked in place element of the Board

    • activate

      public void activate()
      Activates the Tetro Allows for storing Tetrominos without them being moved down/in the game

    • moveDown

      public void moveDown()
      Moves the current Tetromino down by one First check if moving down is in bounds and whether it collides with a locked square If can move down push the origin (topleft) Coord of the Tetro down by one Reassign the squares TetrisSquare occupied by the Tetro according to the new origin If can't be moved further down, lock the Squares of the Tetro

    • moveRight

      public void moveRight()
      Moves the Tetromino to the right by one column Wrapped in invokelater Checks if moving right is in bounds or stopped by a locked square If moving left is possible do it, reassign sqaures TetrisSquare

    • moveLeft

      public void moveLeft()
      Moves the Tetromino to the left by one column Wrapped in invokelater Checks if moving left is in bounds or stopped by a locked square If moving left is possible do it, reassign sqaures TetrisSquare

    • pushDown

      public void pushDown()
      Pushes the Tetro down as far as possible First we copy the the origin coordinate, and then simulate dropping it down by 1 row while as long as it doesnt hit the bottom or a locked tetro After we find the lowest possible coordinate we set this for the Tetro Height, width and occupied squares need to be recalculated aswell. The part of the method that modifies data is wrapped in invokLater to keep it thread safe

    • rotate

      public void rotate()
      Rotates the Tetromino if possible, determined by canRotate() method Wrapped in swingutilites.invokelater to ensure that its thread safe with the gameloop With rotation the occupied squares, width and height of the Tetromino also changes, these are reassigned after rotation

    • getActive

      public boolean getActive()
      Checks whether the Tetromino is currently active.
      Returns:
      True if the Tetromino is active, false otherwise.

    • getTopleft

      public Coord getTopleft()
      Retrieves the top-left coordinate of the Tetromino.
      Returns:
      A Coord object representing the top-left position.

    • setTopleft

      public void setTopleft(Coord topleft)
      Sets the top-left coordinate of the Tetromino.
      Parameters:
      topleft - A Coord object representing the new top-left position.

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      Retrieves the color of the Tetromino.
      Returns:
      A Color object representing the Tetromino's color.

    • getSquares

      public List<TetrisSquare> getSquares()
      Retrieves the squares that make up the Tetromino.
      Returns:
      A list of TetrisSquare objects representing the Tetromino's squares.

    • getLwidth

      public int getLwidth()
      Retrieves the left width offset of the Tetromino.
      Returns:
      The left width offset as an integer.

    • setLwidth

      public void setLwidth(int lWidth)
      Sets the left width offset of the Tetromino.
      Parameters:
      lWidth - The new left width offset.

    • getRwidth

      public int getRwidth()
      Retrieves the right width offset of the Tetromino.
      Returns:
      The right width offset as an integer.

    • setRwidth

      public void setRwidth(int rWidth)
      Sets the right width offset of the Tetromino.
      Parameters:
      rWidth - The new right width offset.

    • getHeight

      public int getHeight()
      Retrieves the height of the Tetromino.
      Returns:
      The height as an integer.

    • setHeight

      public void setHeight(int height)
      Sets the height of the Tetromino.
      Parameters:
      height - The new height of the Tetromino.

    • getPanel

      public TetrisPanel getPanel()
      Retrieves the associated Tetris panel.
      Returns:
      The TetrisPanel object associated with the Tetromino.

    • getShape

      public TetroShape getShape()
      Retrieves the shape of the Tetromino.
      Returns:
      The TetroShape object representing the Tetromino's shape.

    • setShape

      public void setShape(TetroShape shape)
      Sets the shape of the Tetromino.
      Parameters:
      shape - The new TetroShape for the Tetromino.

    • setActive

      public void setActive(boolean flag)
      Sets whether the Tetromino is active.
      Parameters:
      flag - True to activate the Tetromino, false to deactivate it.
